data.title: Paint your blues away
data.text:
Kana winery hosted a paint and drink art class.  IT WAS SO MUCH FUN!!!!!!  It was yucky raining day and we painted our weather blues away.  

Kana winery has a sophisticated yet laid back hippy feel with wine titles like Dark Star and Working Man's Red.  How could it no have a hippy feel with wines names like that!  For those who might not recognize those names they are song titles from the Grateful Dead.

Live music on the weekends, classic rock, reggae........ a wine bar but so much more they even carry for beers for those that are not wine lovers!!  Don't miss out on the fun!

owner_response.author: Katherine G, General Manager at Kana Winery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank  you so much for the wonderful review!
Cheers,  Katherine
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fun atmosphere
data.text: This is worth a stop for some wine tasting.  Nice options for tasting at $5.00 per person and conveniently located downtown.  The front door sticks, so push hard.

owner_response.author: Katherine G, General Manager at Kana Winery, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review on Kana Winery.  We try to fix the door but unfortunately the hardware is as old as this historic building. Built in 1931, but I am also looking at new ways to figure this problem out! lol
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Friendliest Winery in Yakima!
data.text: Great wine at good prices.  Staff is very helpful and very familiar with the wine selection.  They don't serve food, but you can bring your own.  Also, there is usually entertainment on Friday evenings.  Every visit has been delightful.

data.title: Delicious wine and friendly staff
data.text: We arrived too late for a tasting, but decided to buy a bottle and stayed for the live open mic entertainment.  The staff are knowledgeable and very welcoming.  The atmosphere is friendly and relaxing.  The wines are well balanced, good quality, and reasonably priced.  I wish I had time to go back for a full tasting.  I will definitely do that the next time I'm in Yakima.

data.title: fresh funky atmosphere and great servuce
data.text: Loved the Dark Star!  Bought several bottles as presents for friends (only $22).  There is plenty of room in the tasting room for bigger parties.  The staff is knowledgable and friendly.  Learned a lot about wine in the valley from this shop!

owner_response.author: Katherine G, Guest Relations Manager at Kana Winery, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time out of your busy day to write this kind review.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice place to visit!
data.text: Friendly staff and good service--great atmosphere, too!  I feel like I'm among friends whenever I walk in here.

data.title: Super Friendly
data.text: The folks here are so friendly, we always feel special when we come here. And the wine is very tasty.

data.title: Wonderful local winery
data.text: This is a great place to meet friends or make new ones. Friendly staff, good wine and often really good music. Uniquely expanded with interesting decorating touches to accommodate more people.

owner_response.author: Katherine G, General Manager at Kana Winery, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We truly appreciate you taking time to write about your experience at our tasting room!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A few favorites
data.text: I love shopping at Kana Winery. My sister and I began visiting them when they first opened, and I go back several times a year. I love the Rhone varietals they specialize in and I find their flagship Dark Star consistently excellent each year no matter what the combination of grapes. Their Old Vines Lemburger is great with lamb dishes and my husband likes the Katie Mae because it tastes the most like the Mosel style Rieslings he first tasted 38 years ago in Germany.

owner_response.author: Katherine G, General Manager at Kana Winery, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are very excited to hear how much you and your husband have been enjoying our wines for several years! We are approaching the 12 year of producing wine. Each year has been quit an experience, filled with laughter, love and new friends. Thank you for being a fan!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Kana is the best
data.text: Kana winery in Yakima has excellent wine at a great price, a wonderful Grateful Dead themed tasting room, friendly staff, and are the best live music promoters in the valley. The place to go when you visit Yakima

owner_response.author: Katherine G, General Manager at Kana Winery, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Leni - We thank you for putting in your thoughts about Kana Winery. Especially bringing in family while in town.  Cheers
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Really Cool Place!
data.text: Love this tasting room!  The wine is delicious, the people are really friendly and there is often great live music.

owner_response.author: Katherine G, General Manager at Kana Winery, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Beehlers - Thank you for taking time to write about your experience at Kana Winery tasting room.  Come back again real soon. First Friday-Nov 2015 is right around the corner.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Highlight of Yakima
data.text: What we experienced is that Kana Winery goes out of the way to make you feel right at home and adds a special fair to visiting a winery tasting room. Very polite, courteous, and fun loving staff made the tasting experience a blast! Great Wine and Great live music from time to time (especially on the first Friday evening of each month) makes Kana worth the stop. Thanks Kana!

owner_response.author: Katherine G, General Manager at Kana Winery, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking time to write about your experience at our tasting room.  We do have wonderful wine. The music is an added plus for our guests and for our staff. It's always nice to hear nice things, again thank you, we hope to see you again very soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great wine and atmosphere
data.text: Got a chance to enjoy a bottle of Scarlet Fire Red wine from Kana last week and loved it. The live music sets a great atmosphere , plenty of seating and such a friendly informative staff.

owner_response.author: Katherine G, General Manager at Kana Winery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for making Kana Winery one of your destination stops. Our goal is to make you happy with wine and friendliness. Cheers to you!

Katherine Goodson
General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Lots of potential but no follow through....
data.text:
No acknowledgement when we walked in, nor as we stood - perfectly visible - at the tasting bar. Weird considering it's not that big and it was pretty obvious we were newly arrived. Seems the two women and the man behind the bar felt their conversation (about washing wine glasses) was more important... Just about to leave when one of the women engaged. Yay. So we each ordered a glass (tasting was over) and found a table to enjoy the wine and the guitar player (who was great by the way). Finished our wine and would easily have had another (and maybe even another...the music was that good), but the servers had found their own seats at a table with some friends and were enjoying their own bottle of wine. The weird thing is that one of them did get up to help a couple that arrived and sat next to us however, during the taking & delivering of that new order, she never bothered to check in with us or the other couple next to us, also with two glaringly empty wine glasses on their table. We exchanged the old rolling eyes look and left. 
Honestly, we saw a sign saying Yakima is the "Palm Springs" of the North but, folks, you've got a looooong way to go.

owner_response.author: Katherine G, General Manager at Kana Winery, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are very sorry for hearing you did not have a good experience here.  We are trying all the time to make us better.  With your help as you remarked we have made changes.  We have been here for 11.5 years and newly expanded the tasting and the hours on the weekend.  There have been some bumps along the way but I feel we have corrected these. Please try us again while in the area!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice people
data.text: We tasted wines here on a slow Sunday in May.  The server was great! She asked our names and made us feel at home.  She also knew a lot about the wines and engaged us in discussion about them.  The wines were not really for us.  So, that was unfortunate. But, I would recommend trying this tasting room anyway-the great service made this stop pleasant.

owner_response.author: Katherine G, General Manager at Kana Winery, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We really appreciate you sharing your experience at our tasting room. It's always a nice to hear our staff is doing what we want to convey to our quests.  We value your time as a venue stop. We do have music on Friday and Saturday evenings, please stop back in.  We also carry beer!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: What a delight in downtown Yakima
data.text: Never did we expect to find a tasting room in downtown Yakima, not to mention to find it still open after 5pm on a Saturday. We rushed in and were greeted warmly by the wine hostess. We proceeded to taste AND purchase some very GOOD wines at a nice price point (ave $15).  Can't wait to uncork and enjoy!

owner_response.author: Katherine G, General Manager at Kana Winery, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review of our tasting room, I apologize for not getting to you before now.  We value your time and effort in writing about your experience.  We hope you come back to Kana Winery again in the future!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good wine - Disinterested presentation.
data.text: It was obvious that we were just another couple wandering in to taste wine. Questions were answered but ambience and energy missing (certainly compared to Gilbert Cellars nearby). Wine was good and we bought some to take home.

data.title: Looks like "caw-naw", actually "cane-uh"
data.text: We had started off the Yakima Valley Spring Barrel Tasting at Kana for years but had not been back for a while until recently.  We had forgotten that they actually make very good wine.  Practically all of their reds are blends of one type or another which gives the winemaker that opportunity to accentuate the best from each blending grape rather than relying on a single varietal to yield a perfect barrel.  At least, that's my rationalization!  Katherine the manager is a wonderful person and tries very hard to make your tasting experience memorable.  They are expanding the facility into an adjacent area in the same building to make more room for the special events that they host.  They frequently have live, acoustical music and have a variety of Kana and generic Yakima wine industry items or sale.  Great place, great people, very good wine.  Don't miss it.

data.title: Great Tasting
data.text: The tasting room is in a small space in downtown Yakima.  We enjoyed each of the wines, which we couldn't say about several of the tasting rooms in the area.  The art on the label was interesting and the wines were very reasonably priced.  An very good stop for us.

data.title: Small but very nice in the heart of Yakima
data.text: We had done wine tasting tours in the valley around Yakima but never in the downtown area.  this is a small store front but very nice.  Tasteful decor and gift items.  Good wine.  We were a large group and the server did a nice job of making sure to explain the different wines.  A good day was had by all.
